channel.title: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)
channel.description:
Hello, I have changed Sprite.java to load the background from an image, but any image i use is flipped by the client, can anybody please help me?
I have removed image flipping in non renamed clients before, but I can see its not such an easy task with Project Insanity clients... :eek:

item.title: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

I have to load up different images and i cannot divide them all in half…

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)

item.title: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

Here is a super easy fix:

Divide your pictures width in half and select the right half. Then… Flip it!

Amazingly enough, this will fix the image!!!

Sarcasm May Be Intended

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)

item.title: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Thanks dudes :), but i need to load it from a URL not a cache entry

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)

item.title: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Why hard-code?

I believe if you place the full image in the cache, (where it was previously loaded from), it will not flip.
Though, if you place only half the image, it will mirror it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with project insanity client background flipping (urgent)

				k++;
			byte1 = abyte0[i1++];
			if(byte1 != 0)
				ai[k++] = ai1[byte1 & 0xff];
			else

			else
